title: Latin America: Citi Stands Alongside Microentrepreneurs at Regional Event Promoting Business Development
summary: Buenos Aires, Argentina - The Citi Microentrepreneurship Award, the flagship initiative of the Citi Foundation, showcases the importance of micro-entrepreneurship and microfinance in financial inclusion processes and the socioeconomic empowerment of low-income individuals. Since its launch in 2005, 36 countries have joined the program and use the contest to recognize the contributions of microentrepreneurs and microfinance institutions to their local economies.
tag-1: Latin America: Citi Stands Alongside Microentrepreneurs at Regional Event Promoting Business Development
tag-3: Buenos Aires, Argentina – The Citi Microentrepreneurship Award, the flagship initiative of the Citi Foundation, showcases the importance of micro-entrepreneurship and microfinance in financial inclusion processes and the socioeconomic empowerment of low-income individuals. Since its launch in 2005, 36 countries have joined the program and use the contest to recognize the contributions of microentrepreneurs and microfinance institutions to their local economies.
tag-4: To celebrate the program's 10th anniversary, Citi and the AVINA Foundation, in partnership with the NGO Aportes de Gestión para el Tercer Sector, organized a workshop for the 2010, 2011 and 2012 winners in Buenos Aires. "Entrepreneurial Experiences: Planning for Growth," was held November 11 through 15 and included participants from Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Guatemala, Paraguay, Peru and the Dominican Republic. The event was designed to emphasize Citi's ongoing assistance to the sector and to gain a better understanding of the needs of the region's microentrepreneurs.
tag-5: The participants spent three full days sharing experiences and exchanging information about their projects. The discussion identified common challenges, best practices and collaborative medium-term growth strategies, led by an expert in small business development and knowledge management. The session's conclusions will be compiled into a document for systemizing business initiatives, facilitating the process of replicating successful projects at various scales.
tag-6: "We know that access to top-level training and advice is a key ingredient in promoting innovation and ensuring the social, environmental and financial sustainability of model businesses," remarked Sergio Barrero, Regional Head of Corporate Responsibility at Citi Latin America. "We are committed to supporting this type of experience around the region."
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-9: The Avina Foundation The Avina Foundation seeks to articulate, invest in and facilitate regional and national strategies for change in Latin America, using its resources, local presence and relationships with thousands of partners in the region.
